title: Missouri Botanical Garden, Saint Louis
review_list:
Winter or summer, this is a perfect place to walk around and enjoy the outdoor beauty. Well-kept and well organized, this is a St. Louis treasure

Spent the day at the Missouri Botanical Garden orchid fest had a beautiful time everywhere you looked was color. The climatron is a warm diversion from a chilly winters day. A wonderful way to spend your day. The gift shop and restaurants are also recommended. Classes for everything from gardening to watercolors and special events to pique many interests.

Outstanding orchid displays and nice gift shop. Nice break from February weather. Extra charge for orchid show in addition to entry fee. Plenty of parking and nice view from restaurant

Beautiful Gardens and not overly crowded. This is one of those lesser sites tourists flock to. The best time to come is the fall or early winter. Good for families, couples, friends or solo.

I can't say enough about the Missouri Botanical Garden. My daughter was married in the Japanese Garden 7 years ago and every time I go back I remember how special this place is. It has a tram to take you around or you can walk. There are concerts on Wednesday nights in the summer and there are always special exhibits...


More  



Even though it's winter there is still plenty so see at the Missouri Botanical Garden. The Orchid Show is on throughout February and is indoors. Inside the Climatron it's always tropical. The Tower Grove House offers a Victorian atmosphere and history of the early days of the Garden. Sassafrass Café offers a great menu and free WiFi.

An Englishman named Henry Shaw settled in St. Louis in the early 1800's. He was an avid gardener and loved a great piece of land. As his fortune grew, he decided to give his new found home (St. Louis) a gift in the form of a world-class botanical garden. Shaw's gift to St. Louis is among the oldest and most...


More  



The GLOW is such a de-LIGHTFUL treat 4 the holidays! Allow 2 hours at least. Prime times are after sundown so purchase tickets early for the night showing the lights will delight. Dress in layers if it cold because people stop in front of you for a closer look or photos, which may have you out in the cold temps...


More  



The grounds of this botanical gardens are amazing, a hidden gem in St. Louis. Plants and lawns are beautiful, many different area and garden settings. I liked the japanese garden area. The buildings are also lovely.

We visited the Botanical Garden in the dead of summer and were pleasantly surprised at how comfortable it was, given the heat. We wanted to see the blooming Corpse Flower, and that was an amazing experience! Smelly, but definitely unique! Bring your camera and if you're like me, be prepared to write down the names of plants you wish to...


More

title: St. Louis Zoo, Saint Louis
review_list:
Everyone was so pleasant and courteous. It was an enjoyable way to spend the day. I would recommend it to families, couples and singles. I've been to several zoos across the country and this one is definitely one of the best.

Been a lot of places. Been to a lot of zoos. This one is extra special and very nice. Admission is free, the exhibits and animals are extremely well done. The gorillas were impressive and easy to view. The bird house was clean and full of birds I have never seen. Overall, this is a special place and well worth...


More  



This is the Best Zoo Ever. Snakes and turtles were very informative tour with head Zoo keeper. The Primates were also very exciting and the personal tour was incredible!!!!!!!!

St.Louis zoo is one of the best zoo's of the nation and it's all for free. Well, parking cost 10 bucks, but there is free parking but hard to find. The exhibits are well done, I like the old style of open pens. Animals are always out and easy to see. The penguins and prairie dogs are my favorite and...

If you are in St.Louis, the best free activity to do is visit the St.Louis Zoo. Parking costs $10 in the parking lots and if its available, I would do that. If you don't park in the parking lot then you have to find a spot along the street to park and I always drive around for a half an...


More  



yep penguin here are the best! up close a personal. i love this zoo. i will go back we always have a great time here.

We love trips to the zoo. Such beautiful scenery and animals. Awesome shows! The animals are very well cared for.

Great place to go but plan to go early for the popular attractions like the polar bear area. Oh and bring your own food and park further away to make it cheaper.

By far the best Zoo I have ever been too. It's free to get in and it is easy to navigate. The items that do cost are not going to break the bank.

The St. Louis Zoo is one of the best, if not the best zoo in the country. They have a mind-blowing variety of creatures. From bugs to elephants and everything in between. Not only can you see all kinds of animals but there are areas in which you can interact with and pet certain animals also. It's a great time...

title: Cathedral Basilica of Saint Louis, Saint Louis
address: 4431 Lindell Blvd, at Newstead Ave, Saint Louis, MO 63108
review_list:
The Cathedral is probably my top-ranked thing in the city - the most beautiful thing to see - so impressive, so huge and breath-taking. Please be respectful when visiting.

The amazing Basilica has mosaic tiles only surpassed by the Blue Mosque n Istanbul. Well worth a look and like the guy on the Trolley Cart says when he takes you around St Louis "and its absolutely FREE"

If you are visiting the Central West End area of St. Louis, take time to visit the cathedral. The mosaics inside are just stunning. A must see whether you're Catholic or not.

What a buetiful church, im happy i was able to visit it. Lit a votive for our unborn son. The gold on the ceiling is spectacular.

We have been here many times.
I came here with my class when I was in grade school. We watched one daughter get confirmed here and another was married here. Our granddaughter sang here in a Christmas concert.
We always appreciated the beauty of the New Cathedral and knew some details about the exterior architecture and artistic elements of the...


More  



Very beautiful mosaics and peaceful place but don't take young kids to the service because it is very boring and ceremonious .

Check online to get exact time, but they have fabulous guided tours on Sunday's, I think around noon. The Cathedral is drop dead gorgeous, w/several areas having been designed by Tiffany's. If my memory is correct, I think our incredibly knowledgable guide told us that this cathedral has the most mosaic glass of any building in the world. Treat yourself...


More  



Probably the most hidden treasure in St. Louis. Besides being a staggering piece of liturgical architecture, it contains the largest mosaic fields in the United States. Basically the entire interior is covered in small mosaic pieces that are beyond breathtaking. The building is mainly called the "new cathedral" as there is an equally fascinating "old cathedral" next to the arch....


More  



Our family attends church at the Basilica every Christmas Eve. Service is always beautiful, decorated beautifully, the songs and sermons are always meaningful and full of hope. Great place to take the family, but perhaps with older children. Young children can get fussy and really disrupt the service.

The tile work on the walls and ceiling are amazing. Our tour bus guide claimed it was second only to the Vatican according to one of the popes.

We've driven from Atlanta to St. Louis (twice - about 8 hours) just to go to the City Museum.
If you are ever anywhere near there, go!!

I loved going here and running around even as a single adult. I would highly recomend this place for young kids with a lot of energy. Bring knee pads and have fun.

We went together as an extended family, Aunts, uncles, grandparents, teens, children, etc. Lots of hands on for all ages. Reasonable and informative.

title: Busch Stadium, Saint Louis
review_list:
Beautiful and clean stadium. Ballpark village surrounding the park is a fun, clean atmosphere. Easy to get to from downtown. Love the outdoor park like area with big screen tv and bar (for viewing the game if you don't have a ticket or have antsy kids when it's the 14TH INNING!)

This is a great experience for all. Even if you're not a Cardinal fan. Maybe even if you're not a baseball fan. Great stadium. Great fans!

This stadium was completed in 2006, and is the 3rd Busch Stadium. You can find some pretty good deals on Cardinal tickets. Anyone can have fun at a Cardinals game. Fans are welcoming and friendly. Enjoy watching the best team in the MLB.

I always go to the redbird club for the AC and lock doors, i enjoy this place and my family feels safer in the blocked of areas.

I grew up in the Lou and I really miss the original Busch Stadium. Having said that, this really is a nice park. They have kept the old world park feel yet made it with modern touches. Get a tour, watch a demo game or come to watch the Cardinals. Great place to spend time with friends and family.

If you are a native of St. Louis or a visitor, a trip to Busch Stadium for a game or a tour is a must. The Cardinals are a first class team run by a first class organization. You will enjoy the tour and get the opportunity to see the stadium up close. The best experience though is to attend...


More  



A summer trip to St. Louis wouldn't be complete without scheduling a visit to Busch Stadium to watch the renowned St. Louis Cardinals baseball club. Baseball fans everywhere seem to agree that there is no city in the country that supports its baseball team more (year in and year out) than St. Louis. In addition to being true "fans", St....

Pay parking garages are near by, so you can spend an afternoon touring the stadium and the Arch, nice shops around the stadium. We enjoyed our visit.

I have attended many games at Busch Stadium III and its predecessor Busch Stadium II, however my best experience was on October 27th, during Game 6 of the 2011 World Series against the St.Louis Cardinals and the Texas Rangers. Since growing up I had always been a Cardinals fan, however my favorite player as a child was Nolan Ryan. Nothing...

This is a great baseball stadium! It worthy to see some matches of Cardinals! They have a big season with games almost everyday!

title: Forest Park, Saint Louis
review_list:
A beautiful 78 degree sunny day in February bringing our many local residents to enjoy the park, zoo, museums, worlds fair attractions remaining for over 100 years, etc. I still find this the most beautiful, well used, park in the country.

Forest Park was the site of the 1904 Worlds Fair. There is a lot of history within this park. There are a lot of buildings throughout that are dated back to that date. The Zoo, The Missouri history Museum, The St. Louis Art Museum and a the St. Louis Science Center are all located in this park, among many other...


More  



It was freezing the days we went to Forest Park - the best and most informative way to see it is the Trolley Bus that leaves from the casino down near the arch.

This is the largest city park in the US - there are "secret" spots all over the place. Don't be stupid and walk around at night but otherwise it is a safe area. Play ball, ride horses, fly kites, walk your dog, picnic, take photos, people watch; have a great day!

Forest Park, more acreage than Central Park in NYC, is one of the most beautiful city parks in the US. One of STL's top attractions. It's a must see when visiting the City.

Forest Park is a St.Louis treasure, larger than NYC Central Park and has just as much character. Within the park you can find many things to do, from the Muny, The Boathouse, the Zoo, Art Museum, History Museum. The park also caters to golfers, bikers, runners, and another outdoor enthusiast.

We had Beautiful weather and the Park was very nice. You can drive thur the Park going to the museums.

Because most of the attractions are free throughout Forest Park, its a good idea to plan your day early in the morning to avoid the crowds. Traffic can become so unruly during the day, especially on weekends...don’t get frustrated...just enjoy the beauty of Forest Park.

I love to go to Forest Park and+jus sit and enjoy my surroundings. I have a spot i visit regularly and the ducks are waiting for me. I go with a pack of crackers and feed the ducks and I promise..I think they know my car... Great.. Simple.but very relaxing for me. I also attend twolight tuesdays.. Which offer free...

wonderful park, lots to do, ice rink, fishing, gardenings in door and outdoor, meusems all FREE get ready to llspend at least one to two days here

For me, this is a one time deal. Long lines and crowded, but at least it wasn't expensive ($15 approx.). Cool view in the arch. Glad I can say that I had this experience but it's not something I want to take the time or money to do again.

Got some great shots on the outside and i wanted to go inside but needed to go to work. I was going to return for the weekend and just so happened it closed that weekend for the season

So disappointed. The arch and its museum were not available to tour. Disappointing. We did tour the old courthouse where security guard, Don, gave photo tips and information. Fascinating Dred-Scott display.

i went up to the top. there's a recording detailing the history of the arch that quits about half way up. then it was just scary! i'm not AFRAID of heights, but i do lose my balance. i will never go up the ARCH again! the museum UNDER the arch is amazingly informative and enjoyable. i learned a lot from...

Just get in a ride to the top, you cant see down until you get up there. No really just do it. make you hand buy the ticket, now your feet walk to the pod and get in. now enjoy the ride.

Went to the Gateway Arch with a girlfriend on a weekend trip to st. Louis. It was nice how you take the small elevator shaft up to the arch, the history of the Arch of course is impressive too. However, compared to other Towers and architecture that I rode up to the top this did not really compare. Overall I...

I love people watching here. People get so freaked out about the ride up in a tiny capsule that jumbles around then they freak walking up the elipse then freak looking out the windows. For a GREAT view - this is where you want to be. The tallest monument in the world and an architectural wonder.

The Gateway Arch is a "must see" if you are coming anywhere close to St. Louis. There is construction going on around the area but it shouldn't be an issue.

We stopped in St. Louis to see the arch and Busch stadium, Unfortunately the Arch was closed for refurbishing but it was still an amazing piece of Americana to see.

title: The Fox Theatre, Saint Louis
address: 527 N. Grand Blvd, Saint Louis, MO 63103
review_list:
The Fox is a great place to see a show, a concert or any event. The Theatre itself is worth the price of admission. A St. Louis Treasure.

If you are looking for an Off-Broadway experience, The Fabulous Fox Theater is the place for you! The venue itself is fantastic- incredible chandeliers, an amazing organ- and talented organist, and the shows that are brought to the Fox are as good as what you would see in NY or Chicago. You won't regret it!

We go here every chance we get. We've seen Phantom, Wicked and going to Jersey Boys next. This theatre is absolutely beautiful, great sound and in one of the great areas of the lou. A must visit while you are in our great city.

Brought my wife to see Wicked. First time seeing the show, and first time at the Fox. I was blown away.
The inside is beautiful, and historic. The stage is huge, the bathrooms are huge, and the front lobby is large as well.
The ushers were very friendly, and the view was great, the acoustics/sound were awesome. Tickets were a...

My husband and I saw Wicked at the Fox during the holidays. The Fox is always a special place to visit. The ornate details throughout the place are amazing. However, seeing a show during the holiday season was extremely festive. The theatre was decorated on on every level possible. Our view of the stage was fantastic. The Fox should be...

The inside of this theater is unbelievably beautiful. I've been to several of the most famous Broadway theaters in NYC and other cities, and this theater is one of the most unique and beautiful. It has been carefully restored. The people who work here are very helpful and courteous.

Wow! Amazing decor, so many details that it's easy to get lost in just looking around! The acoustics are wonderful and there isn't a bad seat in the house. So much was restored on the inside but yet it still has all the modern conveniences for a comfortable show.

Come on, advertise. You've got one of the great historical treasures in the area. I was able to visit this venue as they were rehabbing it and saw it at completion. What a great job.

The St. Louis Art Museum has been at the core of the arts community of the greater St. Louis area since its inception in 1879. Free parking.
Schedule time to do some strolling in Forest Park, or come back for the zoo/gardens and more!

This is not a GREAT museum but this is a nice museum with some good pieces and they really have done well with space. the grounds are also beautiful.

title: Saint Louis Science Center, Saint Louis
review_list:
There's lots to see and do here, and it's all very well done. Best of all, it's free! There's something for every age, and lots of hands on things to do.

If you are looking for wholesome educational entertainment for the whole family this is your destination. title: Lone Elk Park, Saint Louis

title: Powder Valley Conservation Nature Center, Kirkwood
address: 11715 Cragwold Rd, Kirkwood, Saint Louis, MO 63122
review_list:
Great nature center, wonderful walking trails. Very peaceful. Never seems to be too crowded, but we usually go during the week.

You will enjoy the peace and quiet of this scenic place. The location is very nice and the grounds are impressive. Enjoy!

We enjoyed a hike on several different paths through the woods on a nice day. It was easy to beat the heat here since all the paths were shaded. In addition, my children enjoyed the exhibit in the conservation center.

You can park and walk around the visitor center before or after you hike through the park. The trails are well maintained.

Hiking trails are fairly short but can be pretty steep. Lots of benches so you can take it slow if you have little kids along. Want to walk further? Beautiful hills and valleys, just make the loop again.

This is a favorite place of ours and we love taking our Grandkids there. Lots to see and do inside and out. You can sit and watch the birds feeding outside from a comfortable area with floor to ceiling windows, check on a bee hive as the bees are working inside a glass enclosure and so much more. Lots of...


More  



Easy to get to and handicap accessible. Good trails for people who want easy walks or have limited mobility.

My wife and I like to walk all the loops. It is a great place to take in all of the seasons. The walks are all paved.

I have taken my boys here many times and we always find something new to explore. There is a really nice indoor section where you can look at stuffed animals, pictures of animals and real fish. There are many interactive exhibits, including a tree house and a library. My kids always loved looking at the bees - a real honeycomb...


More  



Beautiful in the spring and fall. Nature trails (one really short one and two other longer and more difficult) and the Nature Center itself has very interesting facts. Nice family outing and also a great venue for picture taking!

Begin with the fact that the SLSO is a world class organization and recognize that this is an extraordinarily innovative collection of talent. And then give it a try.
Go online for SLSO and, without question, you will find a program that interests you. Once you've found your target, expand your horizons and give it a try. You'll be amazed!

title: Campbell House Museum, Saint Louis
review_list:
Step back in time and hear the history of this restored to it's origins, nostalgic, home. There are often groupons or living social deals for this as well as admission discounts in the STL Entertainment Book. Check the website for hours and special events. If you like this don't miss the Eugene Field House which is another hidden gem (has...


More  



We found the Campbell House Museum to be very interesting. It contained beautiful furniture, much of which is original or similar to the original. In many places the furniture has been placed exactly where it would have been when it was a residence, as the result of photos that were taken and preserved. The guides were friendly and helpful.

This home was built in 1851 and it truly a classic historic house museum located right in the middle of downtown St. Louis. It was brought back to its original grandeur and is truly cared for. Our docent was great. Tastefully decorated for the Christmas season.

You will definitely want to bring your camera when you step back in time at the Campbell House, located at 1508 Locust Street, Saint Louis MO 63103. This is one of Saint Louis's hidden treasures.
Robert Campbell came here from Tyrone Ireland when he was 19 years old. Robert made a name for himself in the fur trade, helping blaze...

Recently visited with my husband. Our tour guide was great, he gave us a full history of not only the home but also the family. The furnishings are spectacular. Worth the visit.

Small historic home, easily accessible walking from the convention center. When I went with a friend, we were the only two people in the...

This home is very fortunate to have the original furnishings of the home. The decorator, lady of the house, put way too much in some of the rooms. The guide was very knowledgeable.

Not of the soup fame, Richard Campbell made his fortune in the fur trade. A cool look into an era gone by. We have visited this museum a number of times and always learn something new! The home is set back in time and a glimpse of how the wealthy lived. History made easy of our great past!

title: Jefferson Barracks Historic Park, Saint Louis
review_list:
An amazing cemetery. Full of dear and tears. A great place to pay your respects and give thanks regardless if you have a loved one there.

My dad is buried here. He is a veteran of WWII. There is a lot of history in this park. It sits high on a cliff along the mighty Mississippi river. When he was alive and my sisters and brother and I would come down to a playground near this graveyard. That was in the 1960's. We buried him July...

Amazing this national cemetery is off the radar. We had never heard of it and stumbled across it when we visited the civil war museum. Definitely worth a drive through. Only disappointment is that the park is so large, even though there are maps, you don't know what or where to look for things. I would do some research for...


More  



Such order and care is taken of the whole area. Awe-inspiring to see. Makes you feel like you are walking into a part of history.

Robert E. Lee and Ulysses S. Grant were assigned here. If you are a history buff, read up on this and check it out when you are in St. Louis. If you visit at dusk, there are lots of deer who are used to being fed by the locals. Bring some carrots and the deer will come right up to...


More  



First off the visitors center is hard to figure out. The entry door is a nondescript door on the ground level in the back of the building. More  



This park is breathtaking. Rows and rows of tombstones of people who have served our country. So unbelievable! And if you go right before dusk, there are deer everywhere in between the headstones. Takes your breath away.

This jewel was something we discovered within the past year thanks to members of our church family. The museums will ignite the memories of those who served, their attire, weaponry, battles, and for some, the ultimate sacrifice. The displayed travel date is approximately six months later than our actual visit because the calendar doesn't go back far enough.

Great park for biking, walking, and a fantastic, long disc golf course! Highly recommend, close to many highways as well!

This place is near and dear to my family. My husbands grandpa is at peace here. When we go to visit him, it's always so beautiful and peaceful. When you walk in, you can't be anything but grateful for these amazing men and women that either gave their lives for us or who severed to keep us safe!

title: Frank Lloyd Wright House in Ebsworth Park, Kirkwood
address: 120 North Ballas Road, Kirkwood, Saint Louis, MO 63122
review_list:
Beautiful location in Kirkwood overlooking natural, wooded and preserved Sugar Creek Valley. It has the original furniture from a former local St. Louis artist (only owner) that was designed to fit the angles of the house. Special exhibits including at Christmas are featured.

If you are a fan of architecture, specifically Frank Lloyd Wright, this home is incredible. It is kept almost exactly as it was when its owners lived there. You must make an appointment to see it, and it's well worth it.

Visited here a couple years back with my brother and dad.. Pictures of lloyd's work are always amazing but nothing compares with seeing it in person.. Great house, really enjoyed the design and feel of the house. Tour guide had lots of great information.

With existing example of Frank Lloyd Wright's work fading from the scene, this exquisite example of his Prairie Style design is a preserved masterpiece. To fully understand this artisan's mindset, taking this excellent tour is essential. The beauty of the house and the superbly informative tour makes any visit to St. Louis a complete experience.

title: Soulard, Saint Louis
review_list:

Soulard is both a historic and architecturally significant neighborhood (where St. Louis' Mardi Gras is held each year - pretty fun!) and, more famously, the home of the historic Souland Market. Soulard is an old area of the city anchored by Soulard market, a Farmers Market that has existed about as long as the City. The Soulard area is a mix of residences, bars, clubs and restaurants and the site of the annual Mardi Gras celebration. The clubs are known for good blues, rock and all types of music.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. You can buy anything from live chickens to ground goat. Try the jambalaya.

We were in St. Louis for New Years. We ended up in this area twice. Great history and architecture. Anheuser Busch tour and then Howard's was walking distance. What a great place. Peacemakers on Sidney street was a few blocks away what a great place. Had a good time in soulard.

Have visited the area before, first time to walk through the market! Almost like a small version of Pike Place in Seattle! Still lots of selections even in January!

a family member lived in this area. I can see why she picked it to live. Great neighborhood to walk around, so many bars, restaurants and shops. Sweet spot!

Lots of bars -- many with live music--restaurants and shops. Great area to spend an evening with friends and family.

A small, comfy, art deco historic movie theater. The manager greets the guests before the show, and there are many old posters around to examine before you see a current show. Get the popcorn!!!!

More  



We tried this place on a recent trip to the STL area. Our son is an aspiring chef and absolutely loved the experience. The staff were extremely helpful in explaining the process. We made two cupcakes and they turned out great. Would definitely recommend for anyone with a creative spirit when it comes to creating an individual masterpiece

Sweetology is a fun and different way to be hands-on creative. The atmosphere is great and the cakes and cupcakes are delicious.

Truly a fun, unique experience every visit!
Whether you need a quick fix and pop in for a ready made cupcake or treat to spending more time decorating and enjoying the experience, this store offers it all.
The atmosphere is playfully quaint, the staff knowledgeable and helpful, and the experience a good time for all!

Such a cool, creative place to take my teen girls--amazing array of edible decorations and frostings and the cupcakes are the best in St. Louis! Something really different for those with an artistic, culinary bent…..we had to take home some bags of candy too-the selection is unreal!

title: Kirkwood Park, Kirkwood
address: 111 S. Geyer Rd., Kirkwood, Saint Louis, MO 63122
review_list:
There is a lot to do at this park. Tennis, Fishing, Walking, and much more. Very nice place to hold company or group BBQ's!

I moved out of Kirkwood for about a year, and Kirkwood Park, is one of the reasons that it was so great to come back. My 11 year old daughter pretty much grew up in this park, and it is still one of her favorite places to go and hang out.
The playground, (there are actually two of them, one...


More  



Nice little park in the heart of Kirkwood. Plenty of walking paths and playground equipment. There's also a very nice walking trail that goes around a lake. And if you're a little adventuresome, there's some paths that take you into the woods a ways.

This park gets loved to death with so many great events and amenities in it. I've played softball and kickball on the fields. I played on the playground as a kid and my daughter loves it too! They are constantly upgrading different parts of the park (tennis courts, picnic shelters and bathrooms, most recently).

This 92-acre park is located in the lovely community of Kirkwood. Well designed with adequate parking, the park offers many amenities. My most recent visit was for the 9-11 memorial. The local scouts placed 388 American flags around Walker Lake, one for each first responder who died in the attacks on America. Each flag pole contained the name and photo...


More  



I love going to Kirkwood Park, especially with my granddaughters. The playground has lots of equipment for various ages of children. I also enjoy the path around Walker Lake

The perfect place to unwind and relax. Perfect for families and dog owners. Located on Walker Lake in Kirkwood, Missouri.

Beautifyl little neighborhood park. Great place to appreciate the wonderful little gem that Kirkwood is. Make you feel you are in a much smaller town than a suburb of St Louis!

We love attending the Green Tree Festival in the fall. Always a good time. We visit the park throughout the year as well - many times attending the events at the stage. Easy parking, close to the skating rink & pool. A beautiful park that Kirkwood is proud of. A great place to hold family events as well - the...


More  



I lived 8 door up from the park for several years. The community centre is on Geyer and the park goes farther back.
It's well-kept and offers an amphitheatre, tennis courts, hiking (leisure walking) and the Greentree Festival is held there yearly.
It's not particularly fantastic, if you're wanting a day trip but it's a good community park if you...


More

title: Ted Drew's Frozen Custard, Saint Louis
address: 6726 Chippewa St., on the former Route 66, Saint Louis, MO 63109
review_list:
Granted it was a few hours after eating at Zia's, but it's yummy for sure. Known for their Concretes, definitely need to try if first time going. Definitely recommend going, equal to The Meadows Frozen Custard in PA.

I always ALWAYS bring friends and family here when visiting STL. It's a staple when touring the city, and you won't be disappointed when you go to see why. The concretes are to die for! Worth the drive!

I live right by Ted Drew's and have been going to there for years. I have tried about everything on the menu and everything is absolutely delicious. Truly a delicious treat anytime of the year. Trying a concrete is a must.

I used to go to Ted Drews as a High School student at Cleveland High In South Saint Louis. A visit back there brought back many old memories. and Yes it was just as good as I remembered. My wife loved it also. The crowds where big but the lines moved quickly.

Quick service, great variety, and the best frozen custard on earth. What more could you possibly want?

Never disappointed when ordering treats here! Am a long-standing visitor to St. Louis, and I always get to Drews at least once while in St. Louis. The BEST ice cream sundaes, especially the Hot Fudge! Bon Appetit!

After the waiter explained the difference between a sundae and a concrete, I ordered the Terramizzou concrete and it was wonderful. It had vanilla frozen yogurt and mixed with chocolate and pistachos. I would have liked a place to sit down while eating. Go for a small size as it is filling!!

When in St. Louis you MUST stop here to have a late nite snack of the best frozen custard in the USA!

This is a must stop on Route 66. We called in after lunch for dessert. It was just yummy. We had the 'concrete' and all three of us were really impressed.
This is right on Route 66, which we were driving. I mentioned our road trip to the staff and they produced a keepsake menu, bumper sticker and other stickers....


More  



It was so nice to visit such a neat place on route 66. The girl at the counter got a bit ill when I asked questions like "What is a concrete?" I had no idea. The custard was good. And the people were fun.

title: St. Louis Galleria, Saint Louis
address: 1155 St. Louis Galleria, Saint Louis, MO 63117
review_list:
Great Mall! I love this great Mall, lots to offer and soem wonderful boutiques and great stores to browse in like Anthropologie.

very clean tons of parking!! The mens Dillards has a great selection and very friendly!! Very nice place to kill a few hours

This is the place to go when you have some serious shopping to do!!! I used to go to Woodfield Mall is Schaumburg, IL....but this has so much more....we had everything we were looking for right here...and a great hotel within a block....lots of dining choices to please everyone.....take a trip to St Louis and shop!!

This mall offers a lot with 3 anchor stores, Dillard, Macy's and Nordstrom. Very clean and lots of variety.

Shopping at the Galleria was good. Easy parking, lots of stores, American Eagle Store was friendliest at Mall. Lots of great bargains.

The Galleria is a great place to shop. Great shops, easy parking and nicely decorated for the holidays.

They actually have a White Barn store. Which is a part of the Bath and Body Works store. But it's actually a stand alone White Barn store which is really neat. Everything you need is in this mall.

The usual shops all selling the usual stuff. It was actually very quiet the three times we went there and we wondered if anyone ever uses it - yet the parking was always full. Perhaps the food hall and cafe's restaurants keep it going?

Nice large mall with lots of stores and restaurants to choose from. Some of the big names are Urban outfitters, Nordstroms, Dillards, Macy's, Bebe etc. California Pizza kitchen and Cheesecake factory are also located here.

was recently visiting st.louis for a day, and had an afternoon to spend. i was staying about 5 minutes away , so i could just walk over, and i comfortably spent the entire afternoon browsing, and dining.

title: West County Center, Saint Louis
address: 80 West County Center, Saint Louis, MO 63131
review_list:
We went to this mall specifically to find the Harry & David store. There is such a plethora of stores and food outlets, that it was difficult to find what we were looking for (but we did).

Best place to shop in West County because of the variety. They've got just about anything you could ever need here! Family friendly too

Easily able to find most anything needed in one location from A to Z except nut to bolts for there is no hardware or outdoor store

Arguably the best mall in the area. A newer mall that has a lot to offer most anyone from young and single to married with a family. A lot of mall space, several anchors to include a two-story Dick's Sporting Goods, and most all the usual stores you expect to find in a mall. Not quite as upscale as the...


More  



I was looking for a place to go on a rainy evening in the St. Louis area and someone recommended West County Center. I was amazed at the selection of stores available to browse. Along the outer edges of the mall were quite a few restaurants. There is also a food court inside the mall.

We stopped in when the mall first opened. We did notice some of the stores were not open yet but figured the accident on the highway stopped people from getting anywhere on time (gotta love 270). Love this mall offers Pandora jewelry but wish they had a Disney store. The mall is always clean and we like most stores they...


More  



Considering Malls in St. Louis are dying out (like Crestwood Plaza and Northwest Plaza of yesteryear), this vibrant and busy mall is a breath of fresh air. Lots of shops and we especially like going to Nordstrums because they have the best sales and they carry high quality merchandise. Macy's, Dilliards, and Penney's are also there and seem to carry...


More  



Choices choices choices to get your shopping on! Safe and well lit, best Nordstrums in the St Louis area.

I love this mall. Great stores. Great place to shop. Wish I could have stayed longer. Easy to park. Love the Nordstrom's there. Great Macy's too. Apple store is my favorite.

Safe! Large variety of stores. Good food court. Great walking mall with two levels and several side areas.

title: Mastermind Room Escape, Saint Louis
address: 440 N 4th St, Suite 290, Saint Louis, MO 63102
review_list:
I had never done anything like this before so I wasn't sure what to expect. There was about 10 of us in our group and we did the Castle room. You could tell immediately upon entering that attention was paid to every detail. The riddles and puzzles were complex at times, which made it all the more exciting when you...


More  



We were looking for something different than our normal to do. This definitely fit the bill! We did the killers room with 4 strangers and my girlfriend and I. We were getting the hang of it when we ran out of time. AWESOME experience. Michael was both friendly and helpful. We're already planning to come back for the castle!!

I had never done a room escape before. The puzzles were tough, and it ended up being a good time. I would strongly recommend Mastermind.

Awesome place. I've been to a few room escape places and this one was by far the best. Bring your friends and your thinking caps.

I got a group of people together to do the Diamond Heist for my hubby's birthday and we had such a blast! None of our group had done anything like it before but everyone loved it. I have to say I thought this wouldn't really be my thing since I'm not great at trivia etc. but it was so fun....


More  



Seriously, a GREAT experience! My group attempted to escape the "Creepy Lair" before the psycho killer returned! Unfortunately we were not successful, but we still had a blast! We've been telling people about this awesome experience all weekend! We can't wait to come back! We will be returning to steal the diamond! Highly recommended.

My company booked The Heist as a team building exercise before our annual holiday party. This activity was by far one of the best team events we had ever planned. Everyone was loving the mysterious atmosphere and brain games. The best part was witnessing the strong communication and teamwork that was ensuing as a result of the room. We ended...


More  



We did the creepy lair escape room and had a blast!!! It was VERY challenging and a ton of fun! We will definitely be back! Michael was great to work with and his clues were helpful but by no means a giveaway! Thanks for an awesome experience!!!!

We have been anticipating this challenge for awhile. I felt deep down in my loins that our experience would be one of victory. We had the wit but just ran out of time. Our advisor, a burly man named Michael, was firm yet helpful in an almost fatherly way. He was there to lend a clue when we needed it...


More  



I was invited to Mastermind Room Escape as part of a company holiday party. I had never heard of the place or even the concept, so I looked it up before going. It sounded fun so I was looking forward to the whole experience. Well, I will tell you, my expectations were met and exceeded. What a blast! We were...


More

title: Escape STL, Saint Louis
address: 2650 S Hanley Road, Saint Louis, MO 63144
review_list:
Had a blast, literally! We took the entire hour , had all the right clues just missed the final code by a minute. The room(s) were set up very well and I will go back and try the other room. This was our second escape room and this one was a bit more elaborate. Only issue , it was really...


More  



Did James Bomb and we had a blast! From handcuffed to bomb exploding, the fun kept right on going with each accomplished task or found clue.
Price was right and worth it for the experience.
We will be trying there other rooms.

I was skeptical coming into this, we had a small party, only 4 people, and to be honest, I wasn't sure about this, but we had so much fun! The clues were fun, the staff was awesome and the venue was really really well put together. We really got into the mystery and it was the most fun I have...


More  



Employees were great, and the room we did was very detailed. We were busy the entire time we were locked in, and the amount of information to gather was intense!

I came with a group of 7 friends. The 8 of us and 2 others did the scenario "James Bomb." The staff made the scenario fun but somewhat realistic, and they gave us hints at appropriate times. It was a lot of fun!

Went with a group of 9 people and had the most fun in a very long time. The hour went by so fast. It was really great watching all us interact, think out thoughts and try and solve a puzzle. The clues were especially helpful when we "overthought" some things.
Can't wait to do it again!

We went as a group of 10, eight 13/14 year old girls and 2 moms. We had an absolute blast. The room and scenario was so much more fun than I had expected based on the description. We did not escape but got very close and had so much fun figuring out the clues and working together. The staff was...


More  



Although we didn't escape the room, we had such a fun time! What a great hunt we had and the "escape" clues were so creative! Loved it and plan to do again on a family outing. Thanks, Escape STL for a great time.

It was such a great evening. A group of 10 friends got together and had dinner and drinks nearby and then headed over to Escape STL with very little understanding of what to expect. It was a really great time! Something so different and exciting and challenging. It was hilarious and silly and yet exciting to use your brain on...


More  



Most fun I've had in awhile!! I would definitely recommend this for a couples night out, co-workers, friends, and/or families. We didn't escape the room but we had a blast trying! Definitely worth every penny!!!

title: Escape The Room STL, Saint Louis
review_list:
Looking for something fun to do as a group? Well look no further Escape the Room STL is the perfect group exercise for creating laughs, building bonds, formulating plans and collaborating ideas. It's an exciting way to break the ice whether you're amongst strangers, irritable co-workers, distant friends or usually dull family members; this is sure to get some healthy...


More  



This was so much fun! Our group was made up of 8 family members ranging from ages 14 - 52. We did "The Agency". The first few minutes we spent bumbling about trying to figure out what we were doing, then we got organized. What a GREAT time! The room was hot and 8 people might have been too many,...


More  



If you are looking for an afternoon of fun, try to escape The Dig. Exciting and very challenging. You definitely need help from other people. Extremely well done and our guide was great!

We had 12 people in our group to escape the room. It was very entertaining and kept the entire groups attention. I would do it again just do another room.

This was AMAZINGLY fun!! I had a blast doing the Apartment! The fastest 60 minutes of my life! Did this with my sister and her boyfriend and had a blast!!

Seriously a top 10 event. It was a very fun adventure to share with friends. You have to really use your mind, but clearly the fastest hour I have ever experienced. Fun time with friends, family, teen event, work party, whatever...

Fastest hour ever. Looking for something fun to do with teens? This is a great choice, warning, it's not easy! We did the agent room and kinda failed but Dave gave us some really great clues so he made it fun.
Lots of options to choose from - just remember all your clues throughout the hour!!

This was so fun! We had people of varying interests in puzzles but it was good for everybody - some of the puzzles are harder, but some are easier. This is such a different kind of activity - you get to interact with basically everything in a room and manipulate items to escape. Highly recommend.

For our 17 year old's birthday we took the family to Escape the Room and had a blast! We did the Dig. Very challenging, fun, surprising game. We had the last clue in our hands and time ran out! If we had a few more minutes we would have "gotten" out. The fastest hour ever! We plan to go back...


More  



Came here on the kickoff to our annual office Christmas party. Were divided up into 2 groups to compete against each other. No one won but it was fun and challenging. You get one hour to use clues to get out of your room(s). Very ingenious game and good team building. Would definitely go back!!!

title: St. Louis Ballpark Village, Saint Louis
review_list:
We went to Ballpark Village for the first time, a day or two ago. We went to see country singer Chris Janson. It is a lovely venue with lots of nice restaurants- the hamburger I had was excellent- great wait staff service, above and beyond. Chris Janson was awesome, as usual. But it was way too loud- you could not...


More  



We had ate at the Drunken Fish so decided to wander in to this venue. There is a DJ in a large open area with different bars and restaurants all around it. It is very loud but fun. People tend to stand around the center area with their beer or drinks. It was as if they were waiting to get...


More  



Having been to the Kansas City Power and Light District, we had heard this was a miniature version, but in doors. It was and it was very enjoyable. We were pleasantly surprised that there was a concert on the center. We were able to watch from the Cardinal Nation restaurant. We were also able to have a great view of...


More  



This place is like a giant frat party but with super expensive drinks. Not worth fighting the drunk yuppy crowd to pay $8.50 for a draft beer.. The building is cool, The lay out is cool but unless you love the whole " BRO" thing I'd stay clear. If that is your thing this place will rock for you.

We ate here before the Cards v. Cubs game on Labor Day. My son left his rally towel from two previous world series games. When we returned a few hours later, the staff bent over backwards to find it for him. We were infinitely impressed!

Big TV for sports in the main area and lots of choices for bars. They all pretty much sell the same stuff, so I'm not sure of the point of naming all the little side bars or theming them. If you are looking for the stadium feel indoors, this is your place. That comes with the cafeteria quality food and...


More  



There is something here for everyone. From great restaurants, sports bard and big screen tv's. Right across fro the stadium you are right in the heart of the action. You can be a group of 2 or 200...the village is a great location for after work get together a or a large scale function.
I was there last January with...


More  



Something for everyone here. Many restaurants, great place to watch sporting events. Pick up for brewery tours and trolley rides. We ate at the Drunken Chicken. Very good food and service - price ok.

Had no idea what to do after World Cup game when we strolled across the street and spent the next five hours there. PBR was jammed as was the main Live stage area. Band was very good! Went back for Saturday brunch and football. Food was OK - pork sliders were not good but beer selection was great.
Returned for...


More  



Huge bar with big TV and many games. Right next to stadium. Fudgery has amazing sweets and Sushi resteraunt was good but service could have been better

title: 360 St. Louis, Saint Louis
address: Hilton at the Ballpark One South Broadway, Saint Louis, MO 63102
review_list:
This was our second time here. It was different because it was February and too cold to sit outside, but was still really fabulous. With the amazing views of downtown and the fun, contemporary food - it's like a big kiss HELLO from St. Louis. It's pricey, and portions are smaller but still very tasty.
If you like to have...


More  



If you wants to see the top view of St. Louis important landmarks. This restaurant is the must. It is located on the top floor of Hilton hotel in the middle of downtown in St. Louis. It provides indoor and outdoor zones with clear glass that you can see the Arch, Old court house and the Busch stadium all in...


More  



Great cocktails. Excellent appetizers. The arch is closed at the moment so this provides a lovely 360 degree view of St Louis from the same area, accompanied by drinks and food! Highly recommended. (We went earlier in the evening - I've heard the music gets after 7pm so I wanted to visit before that time.)

I LOVE THIS PLACE! It has become a must on our to do list on our annual trip to St. Louis. Our routine consists on Checking in at the Drury INN at the arch, heading to Calico's for lunch, walking around the park a bit and heading back to the room to shower and spend a night on the town...


More  



Wonderful food!!! Fantastic service and Phenominal view!!!! We will definitely be back here!! Thank you soo much!! I recommend the Hanger Steak!!

Loved hanging out at 360. The staff were very friendly and great bartenders. The views were amazing. Loved the fire pits on a breezy night.

You have to have the elevator attendant punch in floor 26 to get here and there's often a line to do so. Once up top though you forget you had to wait. Views are gorgeous - the arch, the ballpark, the city. 3 or 4 firepits. Plenty of seating. Indoor space as well as outdoor space. Glass blaconies for unobstructed...


More  



We sat outside and had a great experience. There was a Cardinals game going on so we could go stand at the edge and lookout over at the game. The food was good, the service was good, and we had a great time. The entire bar has a cool atmosphere.

If you do not mind spending for the evening, this place is the best to be in.. This is one of the restaurant with roof top access & the beauty is looking at the Busch stadium .. The place is crowded if there is game on... So plan your visit.. Service is absolutely perfect & fast..

Stayed at the Hilton Ball Park for a weekend. While there we went to to 360 rooftop restaurant and bar. What a cool place to sit and eat and enjoy the views. It is definitely a destination to experience. You can dine or drink inside or outside on the rooftop. The restaurant walls are glass and the walls around the...


More

title: The Thaxton & Speakeasy, Saint Louis
review_list:
Our wedding was as beautiful as the decor of this building. When I was looking for a wedding venue, all I knew is that I wanted it to be unique and this place fulfilled every expectation I had and more. Peter, Terry (Mad Dog), and the rest of the staff were amazing, attentive and very supportive of my crazy ideas....


More  



Just went to an event at The Thaxton. The building is beautiful, can't say enough about the Art Deco paintings on the main level. The speakeasy was fantastic. Great drinks, great staff, great music. Will definitely go back!

Had a family celebration there Saturday evening, and it is a gorgeous facility! The art work is absolutely beautiful!! A big thank you to the owner for taking very good care of his customers. Would definitely recommend The Thaxton to my family and friends!!

Excellent experience from the owners to the staff to the facility itself. First class operation. A gem in the City of St. Louis.

I went to a party at the Thaxton this past weekend and was blown away!! Possibly the most unique venue in St. Louis, amazing bar, DJ...everything was fabulous. The owners of the bar were present and could not have been kinder. Go to the Thaxton!!

This was my organization's first time hosting an event at The Thaxton. We couldn't have had much more of a fantastic experience. Kim and Peter were willing to work with us on making the event a win-win situation for both of us, and it ended up being much more than that. Beautiful building you can't find in many other cities....


More  



The venue was unique, the food was delicious, the staff (Peter specifically) was very easy to work with (and flexible to our ideas/needs), the location was easy to get to for MO and IL residents, the valet was fabulous, and the 20s theme was a fun change of pace! This was one of our most attended holiday party in recent...


More  



The space is so unique it felt like mini-vacation to a foreign place in time. And everyone got a kick out of using a password to get in. The staff was very attentive and the food and drinks were great. It was a totally new experience for a holiday party!

The MWIN team had such an amazing time celebrating our annual company holiday party at The Thaxton. Guests could not stop raving the beauty of the space! If you'd like to take your holiday party to the next level, The Thaxton is where you want to be! Overall, we are thrilled and would love to have another party here.

We recently hosted our community holiday party and awards at The Thaxton. We had food on the first floor, but spent most of the time in the basement in the Speakeasy. Due to the sheer elegance and beauty of the venue, we had to put NO effort into preparing the space for the event. Our guests were happy all night,...


More

title: Riordan Tours - Haunted History Tours, Saint Louis
address: 721 N 2nd St, Meets at Morgan Street Brewery, Saint Louis, MO 63102
review_list:
Went on New Years Day with a large friends and family group. Our guide told great stories and didn't miss a beat with the cold weather. I highly recommend if you have the time.

I feel bad calling this just average, the guy who runs the tours is somewhat funny and the stories somewhat interesting. As a complete non-believer in ghosts I took the tour because I find all history interesting, including a history of believing is things that don't exist. For instance I don't believe in magical witches, but would find the history...


More  



Tour was very fun and had a lot of historical information. David was a great guide and his family goes back eight generations in St Louis. Highly recommended.

I loved this tour. I've been on "haunted tours" before in other cities and in St. Louis, and this one was by far my favorite. I liked that it was a walking tour - you really get a feel for the city that way. I also liked the story-telling aspect of it, sometimes tours can get boring if there's too...


More  



Entertaining, interesting, and fun! Dave is a fantastic storyteller and the walking venue only adds to the experience. I highly recommend for pure entertainment and to learn some St. Louis history. We attended as a couple on a date night. This is also great outing for families (with teens and young children) and friends.

The tour was excellent! I love ghost tours, you hear a lot of interesting facts about the city. Our tour guide was an excellent story teller and very knowledgeable. Kid friendly, not very scary at all.

David had just the right amount of spooky mixed with history in his stories. I have lived downtown for three years now and had never heard most of the stories/history David told us about. He was a great tour guide and I overheard him telling someone that next year he will have five new stories to tell! Overall it was...


More  



Dave made the tour so interesting and fun. I've lived in St. Louis most of my life but learned a lot of interesting facts.

David has a wonderful knowledge of St. Louis history and presents the information in a highly entertaining fashion. I would highly recommend this tour, and I'd like to visit again!

The haunted history tour of St. Louis was such a fun and different way to spend "date night"! David was so knowledgable and interesting, and he was a magnificent story teller! Definitely do this one!

HUGE! If you attend a conference here be ready to do a lot of walking and wear comfortable shoes. Best take a jacket, too, since some rooms were warm and some were not. Close to everything, but I would suggest not buying food there its pretty pricey and there are better options fairly close by.

Our company had our annual leadership conference in St. Louis. We had several events at the America's Center. Staff were helpful. Food was great! There were over 900 of us at the event - was impressed with the food for such a large group!

title: Scott Joplin House State Historic Site, Saint Louis
review_list:
Very little is known of the life of Scott Joplin, the great ragtime composer. Joplin lived in this house in 1902, and period furnishings show what it might have looked like at the time. The best part is a player piano with some rolls actually recorded by Joplin himself. A great tribute to a mostly forgotten musical genius.

I visited this museum, hoping for a photo of the building where the great man lived and came away with an unforgettable experience. While there is precious little historical information about how Joplin lived in this house, the restoration and exhibits have been thoughtfully carried out. My tour guide was very knowledgeable and pleasant. However the highlight is the pianolas...


More  



The building has been restored but is still a run down apartment building. No real Joplin artifacts with a weak connection of the man with the building. The functioning player piano playing his music was cool. Could definitely use more artifacts & historical info

Admission is a bit steep, but our tour guide Brian was super. Very enthusiastic and extremely knowledgeable about Scott Joplin and his life. The house is set up in a museum style, with plenty of memoirs, photos, plaques and timelines, etc. It reminded me of other small museums we've been to across the country which are housed in the residential...


More  



Very interesting little museum. Worth a visit if you are into museums. Small fee to see, but a part of history.

I had a dear friend who loved to play Ragtime music, and of course Scott Joplin's name came up often in those discussions. Years later, when I took up the electronic keyboard, it had a rhythm called the "Joplin stride" and I developed a real appreciation for the artistry involved in playing, and of course Joplin's composing, of those many...


More  



I visited today (April 2015) with two pre-teen children. My opinion matches that of Ken F. They have a guided tour on the hour, every hour, which starts with a 15? minute video about Scott Joplin's life. Admission was $6 for adults, $4 for children. Joplin and his wife lived in three different apartments in St. Louis, and this is...


More  



I was the only visitor to the Scott Joplin house when I paid a visit on Wednesday 18th February. The tour guide gave me a personalised tour and was extremely knowledgeable about Joplin's life and music. Like others, the house contains none of the original furnishings, but this is more than made up for by the tour guide's excellent knowledge...


More  



I was the only visitor to Scott Joplin's house on a Monday afternoon and the guide gave me a personal tour. It is a small place and you can see everything in about an hour. On the one hand, they will freely admit that essentially none of the furnishings are known to have belonged to Joplin and many of the...


More  



People interested in Joplin"s music will visit here, but for anyone interested in sociology , urban history , domestic architecture. this is one of only a few examples available. New York"s tenement house museum is unique , but St. Louis has preserved a bit of urban history and I really recommend seeing this for that fact alone. The guide at...

title: Opera Theatre of Saint Louis, Saint Louis
review_list:
Drinks and dinner in the garden, followed by super operatic performances, with champagne served afterwards...what's not to like?

If you like fine singing, great music, powerful drama, and masterful performances, Opera Theatre is where you need to be next season. Many people say they do not like opera, but it is no different from going to the Muny or the Peabody or the Fox. All productions are sung in English and there are English supratitles as well, so...

This was my second year going to Opera Theater of St. Louis and it is great. The venue is in a great area and the theater is intimate. It is still amazing that the music is played by members of the St. Louis Symphony Orchestra and the singers don't need to be mic'd. Set design and costumes are stunning as...


More  



I have been to several productions of the Opera Theatre of St. Louis, and they do an amazing job with great performers. The theatre is small and there isn't a bad seat in the house. All production are sung in English, but they also provide boards with the lyrics.

What this theatre lacks in grandness, it more than makes up for in intimacy. There is not a bad seat in the house and the performances feel very intimate. The productions are lovely and usually there's quite a variety of shows each season. One tip would be to bring a picnic lunch and eat outside before the show. The grounds...

La Rodine on opening night was outstanding! I have been a subscriber to OTSL for some time now and I can't remember there being one bad opera. I have seen opera in other venues around the country and here in St Louis it is just as good!

A pure delight! Bright, funny charming and the singing is unmatched. If you are interested in the future of opera you need to come to St. Louis to hear the fabulous young singers at the start of their careers!

We attended the opera The Magic Flute. It was my wife's birthday and we spent $250 for our seats. Unfortunately a family with 3 small children (under the age of 6) sat behind us. The youngest kept kicking the back of my seat. This was a 3 hour opera. There were times we could not hear the performance due to...

We attended the Jackson Browne concert in the Peabody Opera House. The venue was beautiful and the staff were very accommodating. We also had dinner at the Opera House prior to the show and the food was good. Purchased advance parking at the garage next to the Opera House which was a great idea since we walked from the garage...

Unique performance in a well sized venue...Dialogue of the Caramelites..use your Garmin to get there!

title: Shrine of St. Joseph, Saint Louis
review_list:
So lovely. This beautiful church is a destination. It is the site of miracles, very special. Hopefully you can go when volunteers are there to give you extra information. The side altars and shrines are very pretty. Call ahead to guarantee access.

The interior of this historic church is wonderful. Everything looks like its made from marble, but its actually faux-painted wood. Amazing. They have a great tour available after Mass.

I attended a beautiful wedding here a few years ago. Parking was a bit tight, but it was lovely and it is one of the more memorable weddings to which I have gone. Plus, the two are still wedded and now with 6 children (It has been 15years since the wedding)!

The wedding was held in the Shrine. The inside has been meticulously restored. It was quite a hot day outside yet it remained cool indoors.

The Shrine of St. Joseph features a beautiful interior. I enjoy photographing places of worship and the Shrine did not disappoint. I was permitted to use a tripod. When I entered the church, a tour was underway. Apparently, free tours are offered. I easily found free street parking within a block of the church. If you enjoy visiting churches, I...


More  



We decided to be tourists in our own town and went to mass at the Shrine. What an amazing story and building! We got there early so we could walk around the church before mass. We stayed for the short history lesson and tour of the church. We have been in many churches in the United States and in Europe...


More  



It has the feeling that God really is there, that he resides there, that he is happy there. It was a church built to glorify God and His creation, not to glorify man and his creativity. Please don't go unless you have plenty of time, there is so much to see and wonder at. the silence and reverence of the...


More  



bought me to tears so beautiful and peaceful and I felt a sence of hope and comfort while i was there and it made me feel hope.

Very impressive. Be certain to listen to the talk about the pastor who served this church and was robbed and killed.. it is also the place where an authenticated , by Rome., miracle occured. it is a beautiful church, which was almost torn down .On Holy family sunday, which is the sunday between Xmas and new Years, cookies and punch...


More  



A well preserved church, the altar and the ceiling is breathtaking . The pews you know it's antique , old, heavy and solid wood. They only have one holy mass at 11 am on Sunday's and a tour will follow after mass. I attended the holy mass , very few parishioners but intimate. A well worth visit....

title: Omnimax Theater and Planetarium, Saint Louis
review_list:
A group of 10 of us get together regularly from Church and in late January we all attended the OMNIMAX showing of Jerusalem. Omnimax is a great visual experience -- better for shorter cinematic offerings, as the seats aren't too comfortable for anything longer. It's big, it's bold, it's an experience!

We loved the Planetarium\omni max/science center! In my oppinion this is way better than the City Museum ( too crowded, not a lot of parking ect). We really enjoyed the dinosaur exhibit, the fossil exploration, energy center, and tornado tunnel. The center is really large, great for kids, wheels chairs ect. Even with large crowds inside it was not crowded....

Adults will learn something as well, of course, but the Omnimax films are always visually stunning! The Planetarium star shows are fascinating, and everyone will learn about life in space, the challenges of getting there, etc.

So many things to see and do at this location...a great place for family trips and out-of-towners, especially on a rainy day!!

We don't go to many movies anymore but enjoy going to the Omnimax at The Planetarium in Forest Park.
This week we saw Jerusalem and enjoyed it very much. We received a $1.00 AAA discount on the $9.00 admission.
I want to return soon to see Humpback Whales. It also would be fun to bring our granddaughter to a movie...

We loved the mats that we got to lay on for the show. The planetarium experience was amazing! Our girls loved it! Highly recommend!!!

We visit the Science Center but have not been to the planetarium in awhile. The grand kids wanted something else to do and we were near the north side entrance so we popped in. The price was great but we were very disappointed in the show. Before buying tickets I asked the girl at the booth if the show would...

Been there many times, first with my children, now with the grand children. Always changes with new exhibits and different Omnimax shows. Crowded on the weekends or when schools bring in bus loads of visiting students. One of Saint Louis best locations to visit.

The technology for the D-Day I-Max borders on incredible. The combination of enhanced archival film combined with animation gives you the not comfortable being there. review_list:
A great place to taste St Louis local Schlafly beer production. There are 16 taps on site, all with different Schlafly beers, and they keep rotating.
Schlafly brews over 50 beer styles every year according to their website, most of them seasonally, and they also have the "year-round series". They also have bottled beer, but half of the styles are...

The coffee stout was rich, robust, but with a smooth finish. Had the shrimp and fish cakes (appetizer) since the beer was slightly filling. Not on a diet.. Ordered a side of fries... They are fabulous;). My son got pepperoni pizza and my sister split a prime rib sandwich with her teenage son. Big portions. My sis had an amber...

My husband and I stopped here for dinner after a Cardinals baseball game. There was an extensive number of draft beers and also a good variety of foods to choose from. Many of the items were typical bar food but they did have other things like curry dishes and mussels. My husband had the Cuban sandwich and I had the...

This was a great little taproom. Through the double doors, there was a full restaurant and bar. Straight ahead was an outdoor seating spot and to the left, a small music stage with pub tables, pool and another full bar.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to have some good craft beers of St. Louis while on a business trip back in May 2015 and decided to try Schlafly thanks to a friend's recommendation. Free tour, short but fun. Tasting at the end of the tour gives you a chance to try beers you may not normally try. Fun time, definitely recommend when in the area.

We had been here once before to sample their amazing craft beers on tap. This time we decided to go for dinner. We started off with delicious poutine. The Cuban & the prime rib sandwich were outstanding. Washed it down with a kolsch & raspberry hefeweisen. Really good!

We'll start with the finish- Sticky Toffee Pudding. The portion was huge; certainly too much for one, probably just right for 3. The wild caught salmon on basil potatoes with asparagus and tomatoes was very flavorful. My wife chose the reuben, sans bread. The corned beef was very most and the portion generous.

title: St. Louis Walk of Fame, Saint Louis
review_list:
Going down the Loop on Delmar, it's always interesting to stop and look if you care to learn more about St. Louis history. Only problem is, Delmar is always busy with foot traffic, so one often feels in the way.

We walked all the way up and down the Walk of Fame. It was fun to see who had St. Louis connections and to read about them.

The Delmar area is a great place to explore, and the fact that they have a few blocks to note the many famous people who once made their home in St. Louis makes this even better. Most are familiar with numerous sports figures who made names for themselves in St. Louis, but there's so much more..... Besides the stars (similar...


More  



When you walk the sidewalk, if you can, stop and read what each star says.
You might be surprised as to who all is listed.
As you walk, there are lots of stores and places to eat at along the way.

This place, unique to the STL area is not unlike the Walk of Fame in Los Angeles, only the famous sons and daughters from the STL metro area. Its a good excuse to walk down Delmar and check out the shops and places to eat!

It was fun to walk along and read the stars. Luckily, this Walk of Fame is located in a trendy area with plenty of restaurants and shops to make it worth a visit.

I enjoy walking along and reading the stars. So many interesting and famous folks from St Louis. This is an attraction that adds to the charm and uniqueness of St Louis.
The Walk of Fame is in an area called "The Loop" which I quite like. We have been many times and enjoy the variety of shops and restaurant in...


More  



Not quite the same as Hollywood's, but a nice idea. Located in the hip, trendy U city area, lots to see here besides the stars.

Cool to see St. Louis recognize its famous citizens. Interesting to learn about people who I didn't know were from the town. Wish there was actually a little more to do in the area than just walk over and read the gold stars. Something just didn't seem to fit right, maybe it was the neighborhood.

It is a nice walk with lots of little shops and restaurants. We loved the musicians so be sure to carry a few loose dollars to throw there way. But not to many because of the homeless wandering around asking for money. The homeless were few and far between though. We all felt safe and there are so many stars...

title: Holocaust Museum, Saint Louis
address: 12 Millstone Campus Dr, Saint Louis, MO 63146
review_list:
If you call ahead to prearrange a docent tour or join an ongoing high school group (like we did), your visit to the Holocaust Museum will be unforgettable. History repeats itself. The museum renewed my desire to rebuke bullying and prejudicial comments I hear about minorities from differing religious, ethnic, racial, and social backgrounds. As we left two of the...


More  



I certainly learned so much during my time at the museum. It is a very detailed and informative center with kind and helpful owners and operators

For years I've taken high-school students on field trips to visit the Holocaust Museum. Schedule ahead for the date who want. The staff shares their knowledge in interesting ways and you might be lucky enough to hear a survivor. It is a invaluable experience.

Visited this museum Oct. 13, 2015. Was the first time I have ever been there. have visited Holocaust Museums in other cities and countries, so have a good frame of reference. This was very well done and is certainly a credit to those involved. Very detailed , lots of photos , and very comprehensive.Covered the years and events leading up...


More  



Nicely laid out mostly photographic tour of events surrounding the Holocaust in this self-guided collection located within off a Jewish Community Center in residential area of a St. Louis suburb. Some additional relevant material on St. Louis specific history during and after WW-II also a nice addition. An hour is an appropriate length of time to visit.

Nice museum. Not the largest but okay for its size. Free admission but the people at the desk as you came in were not the most welcoming or helpful. I kind of felt like since I was not Jewish they really didn't want me there??

What a touching beautiful tribute. I was so impressed with the displays throughout the exhibit.
My older children very much enjoyed it , as did my husband and I.
We went on Sunday July 26 and the staff working were so friendly and made themselves available for any questions

Who knew St. Louis had such a wonderfully appointed Holocaust museum dedicated to remembering those who perished before us. St. Louis has a very large and vibrant Jewish community and this museum is well done and maintained by the JCCA Center of St. Louis. Must see!

I thought the museum was very educational. It is not kid friendly because of the images. I took the tour and afterwards spoke to a survivor. She was friendly and answered all the questions from my group. I recommend this experience to everyone.

I went with two pre-teen boys. The exhibit was definitely not kid-friendly. It was somber and respectful, everything seemed sepia-toned. They don't have very many 3-D objects on display. The bulk of their display is text and photographs. There were 2 short films altogether. One was actual film footage from pre-Nazi days, showing Jewish life. The other was photographic stills...
